Clip.Title: PHIL COLLINS: GOING BACK TO DETROIT
Clip.Episode: Phil Collins: Going Back to Detroit
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow Phil Collins back to the birthplace of Motown, as he joins the Funk Brothers for one soul-filled night of legendary music.

Clip.Title: PLAY ON JOHN: A LIFE IN MUSIC
Clip.Episode: Play on John: A Life in Music
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Before Bob Dylan and The Band there was John Chohen: the man who saved and celebrated American Folk music.

Clip.Title: THE ACCORDION KINGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Every 10 years, Columbia's top accordion virtuosi gather to compete in a fierce musical battle to decide the undisputed Accordion King.

Clip.Title: BLONDIE'S NEW YORK
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the span of just a few years, Blondie went from a band fighting for punk cred at CBGB to international superstardom, thanks in large part to one album: Parallel Lines. What was the secret behind its success? How did it all come together...and nearly fall apart? Enter the recording studio with Blondie's frontwoman and namesake, Debbie Harry, the rest of the band, and producer Mike Chapman. Their conversations reveal the real stories behind iconic hits like "Heart of Glass" and "One Way or Another" and how they launched punk music into the mainstream.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Haida Gwaii's Southern coastlines are a case study in remote, barren beauty - a cultural, and geological past told through the stunning landscape of Gwaii Haanas National Park Reserve.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Parà is the 2nd biggest State in Brazil. It is also the most exposed to climatic changes flirting with both extremes: long-time dryness followed by violent floods all year long.

Clip.Title: PARK FOR ALL SEASONS; A
Clip.EpisodeSummary: For 100 years Parks Canada has set aside land for Canadians. What seemed like a simple idea has been a struggle to balance the rights of individuals against the needs of conservation.

Clip.Title: OL PEJETA DIARIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: On the Kenya drought

Clip.Title: OL PEJETA DIARIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A look at tourism roll in conservation

Clip.Title: ANIMALS ALOFT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Look into the archives of the National Air and Space Museum where incredible stories of thrilling adventures will be revealed, all with animals riding shotgun.

Clip.Title: Chasing Unicorns
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A group of scientists, explorers and adventurers traces the narwhal's path to its summer home in the high arctic. The path is difficult and dangerous, obstructed by thick sea ice. Their journey leads them to the frozen edge of a changing world.

Clip.Title: OL PEJETA DIARIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A look at the plight of chimpanzees that survive the bush meat trade to become captive animals. At the same time we look at the reintroduction of colubus monkeys into the Ewaso river area of Ol Pejeta.

Clip.Title: OL PEJETA DIARIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Leopard problems in the community.
